data:
Based on the provided information, I have identified four stakeholder groups for the PREVENT-IA project:

**Core Team**

* Involved in the project from the beginning
* Responsible for the development and implementation of the project
* Have a deep understanding of the project's goals and objectives
* Involved in decision-making processes

Stakeholders in this group:

* Project Manager
* AI/ML Experts
* Software Developers
* UX/UI Designers
* Business Analysts

**Frequent Involvement Stakeholders**

* Involved in the project on a regular basis
* Provide input and feedback on specific aspects of the project
* Have a good understanding of the project's goals and objectives
* Involved in decision-making processes

Stakeholders in this group:

* Training Experts
* Occupational Health and Safety Experts
* IT Department
* Quality Assurance Team
* Compliance Officers

**Occasional Involvement Stakeholders**

* Involved in the project on an as-needed basis
* Provide input and feedback on specific aspects of the project
* Have a basic understanding of the project's goals and objectives

Stakeholders in this group:

* Workers with risk activities
* Managers
* Certification candidates
* Site Managers
* Transporters
* Logistics
* Commissioning
* Assembly

**Seldom Involvement Stakeholders**

* Not directly involved in the project
* May have a basic understanding of the project's goals and objectives
* May provide input and feedback on a limited basis

Stakeholders in this group:

* General public
* Regulators
* Competitors
* Suppliers

Here is a table listing the stakeholders in order of involvement and explaining their implication:

| Stakeholder Group | Stakeholder | Implication | Involvement Level |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Core Team | Project Manager | Responsible for project management | High |
| Core Team | AI/ML Experts | Responsible for AI/ML development | High |
| Core Team | Software Developers | Responsible for software development | High |
| Core Team | UX/UI Designers | Responsible for UX/UI design | High |
| Core Team | Business Analysts | Responsible for business analysis | High |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | Training Experts | Provide input on training content | Medium |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | Occupational Health and Safety Experts | Provide input on ORP training | Medium |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | IT Department | Provide input on IT infrastructure | Medium |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | Quality Assurance Team | Provide input on quality assurance | Medium |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | Compliance Officers | Provide input on compliance | Medium |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Workers with risk activities | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Managers | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Certification candidates | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Site Managers | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Transporters | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Logistics | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Commissioning | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Assembly | Provide input on training needs | Low |
| Seldom Involvement Stakeholders | General public | Provide input on public opinion | Low |
| Seldom Involvement Stakeholders | Regulators | Provide input on regulations | Low |
| Seldom Involvement Stakeholders | Competitors | Provide input on market competition | Low |
| Seldom Involvement Stakeholders | Suppliers | Provide input on supply chain | Low |

Note: The involvement level is subjective and may vary depending on the specific context and requirements of the project.
